contentrichtext.text: {{Other persons|Guy Barnett}} {{Infobox MP | honorific-prefix = | name = Guy Barnett | honorific-suffix = | image = | title = [[Australian Senate|Senator]] for [[Tasmania]] | term_start = 26 February 2002 | term_end = 30 June 2011 | predecessor = [[Brian Gibson (Australian politician)|Brian Gibson]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1962|4|4}} | birth_place = [[Launceston, Tasmania|Launceston]], [[Tasmania]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | spouse = | party = [[Liberal Party of Australia|Liberal]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Guy Barnett''' (born 4 April 1962), has been a [[Liberal Party of Australia|Liberal Party]] member of the [[Australian Senate]] since February 2002, representing the state of [[Tasmania]]. He was born in [[Launceston, Tasmania|Launceston]], [[Tasmania]], and was educated at the [[University of Tasmania]]. He was a lawyer before entering politics. He was Senior Adviser to the [[Premier of Tasmania]], [[Robin Gray (Australian politician)|Robin Gray]] 1988-89. Barnett has conservative stances on [[stem cell research]] and [[cloning|embryo cloning]], [[in vitro fertilisation]], [[abortion]], and [[gay rights]], and opposed the decriminalisation of homosexuality in Tasmania.<ref>"[http://www.bewareofthegod.com/wp-images/Barnett.pdf Know Your Politician Information Series]"</ref> At the [[Australian federal election, 2010|2010 federal election]], Barnett was defeated and served until July 2011. He also verbally attacked fellow Tasmanian Liberal Senator [[Eric Abetz]], blaming him for the poor election result in Tasmania, and said the Liberal Party in Tasmania was "battling to stay relevant". Guy now competes in Tennis events around Tasmania,winning a few rounds in various AMT's around the state.<ref>[http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-national/libs-battling-to-stay-relevant-barnett-20100910-154gj.html Libs battling to stay relevant: Barnett - SMH 10 September 2010]</ref><ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/elections/federal/2010/guide/stas-results.htm Tasmanians 2010 Senate seat results: ABC]</ref> ==References== <references /> {{Authority control|VIAF=128373039}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME=Barnett, Guy |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Australian politician |DATE OF BIRTH=4 April 1962 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Launceston, Tasmania]], [[Australia]] |DATE OF DEATH=living |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Barnett, Guy}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Liberal Party of Australia politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Australian Senate]] [[Category:Members of the Australian Senate for Tasmania]] [[Category:People educated at Launceston Church Grammar School]]
